elements.name: coroutine.create
elements.description: Creates a new coroutine, with body f. f must be a Lua function. Returns this new coroutine, an object with type "thread".

elements.name: coroutine.resume
elements.description: Starts or continues the execution of coroutine co. The first time you resume a coroutine, it starts running its body. The values val1, ... are passed as the arguments to the body function. If the coroutine has yielded, resume restarts it; the values val1, ... are passed as the results from the yield. If the coroutine runs without any errors, resume returns true plus any values passed to yield (if the coroutine yields) or any values returned by the body function (if the coroutine terminates). If there is any error, resume returns false plus the error message.

elements.name: coroutine.running
elements.description: Returns the running coroutine, or nil when called by the main thread.

elements.name: coroutine.status
elements.brief: returns the status of a thread

elements.name: coroutine.wrap
elements.brief: creates a thread and returns a function to resume it
elements.description:
Creates a new coroutine, with body f.
f must be a Lua function.
Returns a function that resumes the coroutine each time it is called.
Any arguments passed to the function behave as the
extra arguments to resume.
Returns the same values returned by resume,
except the first boolean.
In case of error, propagates the error.

elements.name: coroutine.yield
elements.brief: yields execution of thread back to the caller
elements.description:
Suspends the execution of the calling coroutine.
The coroutine cannot be running a C function,
a metamethod, or an iterator.
Any arguments to yield are passed as extra results to resume.

info.name: Coroutine
